case.state: Wait, ~player~, why the heck are your boobs out?
Man, I never thought I'd wear this again. I'm surprised it still fits!
Hey, thanks for inviting me! What game are we playing again?
Thanks for inviting me, ~player~. I'm Téa, by the way.
Sorry, did I keep you waiting?
Hey, what's up!?
The Dark Magician Girl?! But that's impossible!
Dark Magician Girl?! How did you get here?
Dark Magician Girl?! Am I just seeing things right now?
Dark Magician Girl?! It can't be!
Hey, are you sure you're old enough to be here?
Probably not a good idea to be wearing a school outfit in a place like this.
I dunno about a seminar, but you're up against a card game veteran, so you're in good hands!
Hold on, I'm not seeing things, am I?
(May sure has a way with words. I hope I don't feel too bad when I beat her!)
I think you know about it better than anyone, Dark Magician Girl.
Cards are pretty tough. Kaiba once knocked a guy down with his Blue Eyes. I think they can handle a little water.
Trust me, you're not missing anything.
Then I will use Dark Magic Curtain. By paying half my life points, I can summon any monster from my hand. Now you can play with us!
Well then, Dark Magician Girl, let's have fun and duel!
It's not a hologram? Oh boy, what am I getting myself into?
Okay, she's real. But then, how did she know I'd be here...?
Chazz Princeton, was it? Yeah, I've heard all about you.
Chazz, here I come!
Hey, I know you! You're Hatsume Miku, from the famous dance game!
No way! Aren't you the Hatsume Miku?
(Oh hey, she's cute. Lots of energy too...)
You got it, May. It's time to duel!
Ok, this time I know I'm not seeing things, right?
Could you be a Butterspy? So I guess there are spirits in the cards...
Futaba, I can tell by your getup that you take gaming seriously. I hope you don't disapoint!
Futaba, I can tell you're a gaming vet too! I guess I don't have to worry about this being easy!
Kyouko, huh? You seem like a fun opponent.
Oh, great, another one of those guys.
Uh, sure, whatever you say. Let's duel.
Just know that I don't back down from a challenge! Not even magical powers are enough to stop me!
You're Chie, right? Ok, I'll humor you.
Have a little faith in yourself. I hope you can give me a little bit of a challenge!
Brr... when did it get so cold outside?
Brr... and I thought it was cold in Noah's virtual world!
(It's up to me now! I better not dissappoint!)
Seriously, ~player~? This is where people go to get robbed! You better know what you're doing!
Talk about being in my element! I hope you're prepared to get owned, ~player~.
What a view... To play a new card game on a scene like this? I've really lucked out now.
What a view... The gang back home will sure be jealous.
W-wait, is that a gun?
Ah! Keep that thing away from me!
Who activated Call of the Haunted?
I must be in dancing heaven right now!
If I got sucked into a vocaloid game, don't take me out of it!
Start the clock and make your move, ~villain~!
Now, ~villain~, it's time to duel!
You brought food? Awesome! Can't duel on an empty stomach!
It's time to duel! Your strategies won't work today!
It's time to duel! We'll all need to adapt so consider it an even playing field.
It must be fate that the table is like this.
Gee, this sure looks familiar.
Oh thank god! I needed a break from dude talk.
Glad to see more women taking up card games. It was getting pretty lonely with just me and Mai Valentine.
Ah, never mind that, now. Let's duel!
Everyone ready? It's time to duel!
My perfect record is on the line. Let's do this!
I've always wanted to play other card games to see how I would do. Thanks for giving me this chance, ~player~
Good luck! You're gonna need it!
I don't plan to lose. Let's play!
I've always wanted to try new card games to see how I would do. Now let's duel!
Stripping or not, I hope you're know what you're in for by inviting me!
I only need one card this time.
I like this hand, except for this one card.
Just a little tune-up. One card
Not gonna settle. I'll take a card.
Just swap this one card, please.
Let's keep it going. I draw!
No swapping yet.
Let's wait and see...
Not worth the risk. I'll keep this hand!
Move along, dealer.
Graceful Charity lets me swap out three cards from the deck!
I'll play Graceful Charity! Three cards, dealer.
Three cards.
Hmm... I'll take three.
I couldn't have gotten a worse hand if I tried.
Full swap! I hope I don't regret it...
Take them all!
This is where my faith takes me! Swap five!
The spell card Reload! It lets me reshuffle a new hand.
I activate Pot of Greed! It lets me draw two from the deck.
Pot of Greed! Two cards, please.
Can I get two, please?
Just two for now.
I like this card. I'll swap out the rest though.
At least there's one good card...
Yep, this hand needs work.
I'll swap these four. Show me what you've got!
Heart of the cards, guide me!
For my next move, I'll take ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Hmm... how about ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~?
Based on my hand, I better trade ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
I'll tribute ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~-- Oh wait, sorry, wrong game.
(Alright! Time to show this prehistoric Nitwit how we do things downtown!)
A pair plus a triple. What was it called again? Think, Téa, think!
(Don't get too excited. They'll know your hand.)
Haha... alright, easy now.
Yes! A few years later and I still got it!
A perfect hand! Just like I planned.
If I'm this good already, I might as well make poker my main game!
You look pretty nervous, ~player~. Afraid I'm gonna stomp you or something?
The heart of the cards is speaking to me. Now there's no way I'll lose!
Don't count me out yet!
Wow, I couldn't have asked for a better hand!
Did I draw the card I need? ...Ah!
Yes! Good thing I spent so many hours watching Yugi and Joey duel!
I've gotten the best hand I can... The unstoppable Exodia! Hah, just kidding!
(Actually that would be pretty hot if you could go back in time for some strip game action.)
(Yeah, imagine playing a strip game against ancient kings and queens.)
Hey, when do you think people started playing strip poker, anyway? It's kind of funny to think about it. Maybe some ancient civilization came up with the game eons ago, haha!
Not bad, but I should do better than this.
You know what I think? A hologram system would make this more interesting. Like in Duel Monsters, the cards you played were projected on the field.
Hmm, I can work with this.
This will have to do for now.
Well, I suppose I can make something out of this. If Duel Monsters taught me anything, it's that even a Kuriboh can win you games.
(Good work, Tea! Now it's just a matter of the others getting a worse hand.)
Eh, I've seen worse.
Will this be enough?
I end my turn. Your move!
Hm, if only there was a fusion mechanic where I could add numbers together. Though I guess that would be too strong.
Uh, I'll place these cards in defense position for later.
Am I taking this too seriously? I sometimes forget this is still a game and all.
Could I...? Yeah, I can work with this.
Considering how lucky my friends have been in Duel Monsters, I can imagine they'd get really frustrated at games like this. Even when you play well, you can still lose.
This is just my take, but expect to get mid hands like these most of the time.
Yeah, I wouldn't waste my breath on this hand.
With this trap card, you won't stand a chance beating me this round!
Ugh... I knew I should have swapped out a different card...
(Okay, gotta think. What would Yugi do with a hand like this?)
Maybe there's a pattern to avoiding bad hands?
Oh... uhm... I'm in a pickle, aren't I?
What the hell? These cards are awful!
This is bad...
I mean, one mistake doesn't cost me the game, right?
Uhh... I play infinite hands to increase my hand size!
Yep, I blew this one.
(What will I do? With my 2-0 record, everyone will think I'm a pretender...)
Not good, not good, not good!
Hey, is anyone else in a rut or just me?
Man, poker is a lot harder than I thought.
Maybe I should stick to Duel Monsters... and Dungeon Dice as well.
It would be pretty helpful if we could use our own decks.
I can't explain why, but even though I'm backed in a corner, I feel incredibly calm...
Yugi and Joey were invited to a special tournament on an island called Duelist Kingdom. Tristen and I went too but technically we were stowaways.
This one time we traveled back in time to ancient Egypt to help Yugi's pharoah sprit return home. It was nuts.
You see that duel disk Chazz is wearing? It's probably the closest thing we've got to weapons in my city.
Aw geez, I should have prepared something for you.
Long, fluffy ears? Hey, that sounds like the mascot Pegasus likes! You know, Pegasus? He supposedly created Duel Monsters.
Long, fluffy ears? I don't know many Pokémon but that sounds like a monster card called Dino Rabbit.
Why don't you ask DMG?
DMG and I have been working together for a while now. I kinda wish I were playing with her instead of against her though.
(May? In a... swimsuit? Is she for real?)
Wait, you mean it? Alright, I promise I won't gawk.
You know, I bet even you could beat Chazz here, Futaba.
Yeah, when you're not being a pain!
Phew, looks like I'm winning this round.
Why in the world would you ask that?
We can't possibly look underage, can we?
Nope, not until now. The gang and I just play a bunch of random games before we focused on Duel Monsters.
When there's a card game being played, I'll be there!
I haven't been playing too many other games ever since Duel Monsters exploded in popularity. It was about time I expanded my horizons.
Uhh, I can play Graceful Charity from my hand. Is that good enough?
What's the big deal? I figured butts were just a dirty subject from when we were kids.
(D-damn it, it's working. She's trying to seduce us with her secret charm!)
Ooh, that's gotta hurt!
Ok, I can see where your magic is coming from now.
Well, Revy, I'm pretty satisfied seeing my own butt in the shower, thank you very much.
When we went back in time with the Pharoah, I met this magician girl named Mana. She seems to resemble the Dark Magician Girl
I know jack about history, but I bet the Millenium Items had something to do with it
I think it had to do with the ancient Egyptians and the Millenium Items. They could do things like see what normal eyes can't.
Whatever you do, you better not use the Millenium Rod for you-know-what.
I bet the Millenium Puzzle reveals a super horny Yami form.
Huh? Well, everyone just fights by playing Duel Monsters. I never really thought about having a weapon.
I'm not wearing it now, but my duel disk is probably the closest thing to a weapon.
I've never seen a dance like that before. What do you even call it?
Looks more chill than ballet. Maybe I should try it too...
Does dancing count? It's pretty much the most athletic thing I do.
When I was in high school, there weren't a lot of catchy songs, though the Duel Academy theme song is pretty good.

♫ Game on, get your game on! Game on, come on, play your cards right! ♪
Ah, sorry, it just popped in my head.
W-what? Who does that?
W-what? Wouldn't that mess up your friendship?
H-hey! You can't just leave in the middle of a duel!
Hey wait! Are you forfeiting already!?
What do you mean "season"? Were you some kind of TV star or something?
Season? Crunchyroll? What's that supposed to mean?
Season? What, it's not like we're cartoon characters with a huge fanbase, right?
I'm sure you know him. His name is Seto Kaiba, and he's so obsessed with trying to beat Yugi.
Seto Kaiba, once the world champion until Yugi beat him. Now he's obsessed with their little rivalry.
Seto Kaiba. He was so obsessed with beating Yugi that he was willing to hurt himself and play with his emotions. What an asshole.
It's gotta be something good I can dance to. Something like EDM?
Lately I've been into Jpop. Every song has a dance to it and I can't help but join in.
I guess that would have to be both Joey and Tristen. They're both a bunch of meatheads.
Wait, that's a disguise? Looks pretty normal to me.
Usually whoever has more attack points just knocks them out in one shot.
Yeah, I'm used to attack points being the most important stat.
Well, it's a Dark Magician Girl deck of course. Yugi helped me put it together.
It's a deck full of all the cards I put together while traveling. Dark Magicin Girl is my ace of course.
Hm, don't you wanna be in Smash someday, DMG?
This outfit is what I wore during the big Battle City tournament, so I guess it's what people began to associate with me.
I have a pink vest which I wore to Duelist Kingdom. I long outgrew it but it's nostalgic.
There's one outfit I love; a yellow top and ripped shorts. Works best when I tie my hair back though.
My birthday is in August so that would make me a Leo, wouldn't it?
Couldn't tell you. I never really followed astrology.
While I was still in high school, the gang and I traveled to a place called Duelist Kingdom to rescue Yugi's grandpa from Pegasus. He created Duel Monsters.
There was a duelist named Marik who was corrupted by his Millenium Rod and wanted to defeat the Pharoah.
At one point the regional champion Weevil was corrupted by the Seal of Orichalcos. Yugi-- the Pharoah just wouldn't let him go without a fight.
Our classmate, Seto Kaiba, he's so full of himself that he might as well be a villain. He's just so obsessed with trying to beat Yugi.
There's one duelist named Rex Raptor who acts like a tough guy, but he's really just a chumpasaurus!
Our friend Mai started off pretty mean, but Joey kept saving her hide! Now she hangs out with us!
(Even though Nagatoro can be a real pain in the ass, I can't help but admit, she can be cute when she wants to be...)
There are plenty of counters to monsters with high defenses, such as the classic stop defense card, or roulette spider.
When in doubt, just beat them with a 7 colored fish!
No way! I heard that song all the time! It was even talked about in the news overseas.
One time in high school my friends and I got sent back in time to ancient Egypt. I don't even remember how that happened.
W-well, I don't see why you have to do all that. Yugi seems to be really happy just being my friend.
Like star chips? Then again, we're not really in a tournament.
As long as it isn't anything too valuable, like a rare card.
You're supposed to wait until we reveal our hands, DMG.
I'm happy for you, DMG, but now we know your hand.
Seriously, who openly talks about this stuff!?
Anything that's not painful-- I-I mean, I wouldn't even know! Don't ask me!
Yugi always taught us effective ways to combine our cards to make the most efficient strategy. Could that skew the probability in our favor?
Duel Monsters is a little different from the computer games you like, Futaba. Everything relies on your thinking.
Duel Monsters is best played using holograms so the monsters come to life. Cool, right?
Time for a miracle! What did Yuno call it again? The hands of chance?
Hands of chance, heart of the cards, whatever! I'm in it to win it!
See? It's not so bad. If I can figure it out, you can too!
Man, I wish we had you on the gang when we camped out at Duelist Kingdom. Most of us could barely cook to save our lives.
Well, since you offered, say there's this girl who you met playing a card game. What do you think she would like to hear?
Yuno, watch it!
You didn't even try, did you?
Wait, but I thought Time Wizard was a 1/3 chance. Then again it sure has been a while since Joey played it...
Yeah, you're right, Yuno! I gotta believe just like my friends did... or something like that!
If card games are what you're looking for then I'm your girl.
Come to the game store in Domino City sometime. My friend Yugi is great at this stuff.
Hide the evidence, that's what! I can't let anyone know about it!
What's the matter? Can't take the heat?
You'll never reach the heart of the cards by insulting them!
Oh, I've only just met this person recently. I gotta find out more about her, haha!
I'm completely lost past the Nintendo 64.
I'm loyal to my N64 and Gameboy, so I can't really say.
Well the PlayStation was pretty popular when I was a kid, though I always preferred the N64 games. Also, what the heck is an Xbox?
O-of course! It never ends well if you accept going down without a fight!
Hey, DMG-- Sorry, would you mind if I called you DMG? It's easier that way.
You would not believe the games I had to take part in. Augmented reality, sleep pods, deckmasters, I'm lucky I got out without a scratch.
Hey! Stop looking at my cards!
Really? Looking at my cards? I figured someone like you would do this, Chazz!
That would be a great monster card.
It's freezing! My legs are numb!
Where's the dance game? Every good arcade has one of those!
At least that cheater Johnny Steps is nowhere to be found.
We gotta come here more often! It's the best place for card games!
It's times like this when I should have brought my dueling disk.
Why does this place remind me of Duelist Kingdom? Must be how big everything is.
Did you make sure the cards were waterproof before setting up?
People have joked about how we don't know what Duel Monster cards are made of, but these cards can't be water resistant, right?
(Playing with duel disks is one thing, but just imagine what kind of tech they got in ~future~'s time.)
(I wonder what kind of card game tech they have in ~future~'s time.)
(Maybe in ~future~'s time, they've made it possible to interact with holograms)
(Come to think of it, ~idol~ could easily get away with playing strip poker on a radio show.)
(Couldn't ~idol~ play strip poker on her radio show? No one would notice.)
I wonder if using weapons is enough for UA. Then again Dueling Discs are barely weapons as is.
You know, there are a couple of hero cards in Duel Monsters too. You guys really give off the same energy.
Is UA Academy anything like Duelist Academy? I hear the school actually opened after I left for New York, but being specialized in non-school stuff sure is something.
Alright, I'm starting to get the hang of this!
I've got it now. It's just like with Duel Monsters. Just needed to get my feet wet a bit.
You know, this game is much easier than I thought! It's nowhere near as complicated as Duel Monsters.
Okay, I just have to go for the pairs.
Okay, I shouldn't shoot for any of those big hands. I'll play safer.
So I should prioritize the high numbers? Oh yeah, just like in Duel Monsters. The higher numbers are always better.
This is it! My last stand begins now! With my friends believing in me, I will believe in the cards too!
If there's any time for a miracle, now is that time!
Just a little more and I win!
Hey, I might actually win! Even I'm surprised!
Talk about leveling the playing field.
You know Dark Magician Girl? She's one of the playable cards in the game. Just being here sounds like magic in itself, isn't it?
Well, Jura, I'm glad you asked. I'd like you to meet Dark Magician Girl, the most beautiful Duel Monsters card of them all!
There was one duel in the virtual world where I would have been covered in ice if I lost. Luckily I had the spirit of Dark Magician Girl to guide me.
Well that's where you're wrong, Bowsette! The Dark Magician Girl may be against me today, but not even you can handle her spirit!
That's why I came prepared. I modified my uniform for the Duelist Kingdom tournament so it could get dirty.
Oh yeah, they're certainly out there. I know my fair share of them. That's why I modified it.
If I remember correctly we didn't have too many card game players at school. It was just me and my friends, Yugi, Joey and Tristin. Oh yeah, and then that rich kid Kaiba.
C'mon, DMG, help me out like you did when we dueled that penguin guy!
Yep, that's me. Right back at you, May.
I figured it's been a while since I played something other than Duel Monsters, and this was a good chance to try something new.
My friends and I used to play a whole bunch of games before Duel Monsters became popular, so I decided to try something new again.
I guess it does look like my old school uniform, but I changed it a bit when my friends and I competed at Duelist Kingdom.
Well yeah, but I had to make some modifications so I could get dirty in it.
Well, it's like they say. When you wanna get close to others, you play together! Works every time.
It's not just the card game, but my friends and I have gone on some crazy adventures because of them.
I mean, our top duelist is a bug-eyed pest, but lots of people are card players where I came from.
You'd be surprised who else plays Duel Monsters, like a super rich business tycoon.
Yeah you could say that. Although, how did you know he was short?
His heart is his best quality. He never gives up even when the odds are against him.
Hey! You were totally bluffing!
You mean it was a trick!? Oh I'll get you for this!
Who, me? I've mostly been dancing or visiting the arcade. Still love a good card game every now and then, though.
Ever since the gang and I came back from Egypt I've been focusing more on dancing. It also gives me a chance to visit the arcade with its dance game.
Get this-- supposedly there are spirits inside the cards that go back to ancient Egypt! Isn't that crazy?

In Duel Monsters, each monster card has different attack powers. When they battle each other, the monster with the highest attack wins.
That's the gist of it anyway.
I can see that, but that doesn't mean I won't kick your ass to next week!
Oh my, a pole, huh? What did you have in mind?
Y-you mean the type where they spin around it in revealing clothes? Sure, if... if it'll make you happy.
Mega Man? Maybe he could use different attacks based on the cards he uses.
Wait, huh? Where did you get that idea?
Detest card games? I mean I've been playing for a while now! Why would I detest them?
You know it! I've been playing for quite a while now, but I'll admit I still have some catching up to do compared to my friends.
I guess not. All the duels where the fate of the world was at stake were left to my friends Yugi and Joey. I was just cheering them on.
Of course! You have cute fairy cards like Shining Friendship, majestic animals like Silver Wolf, oh, and there's also a cubic creature called Moki Moki that's really soft!
It's a great city! I can see why anyone would be intimidated though.
I thought I knew the place pretty well, but it ended up being a huge maze during the Battle City tournament.
It's a pretty unique game, and there's factors that appeal to lots of people!
Of all the games I played, Duel Monsters stood out the most with how much there is to it. I'm sure if you gave it a shot, you'll find somethiing appealing about it.
Well I admit the aspect of collecting cards can be annoying, but just playing with friends is a unique experience in itself.
The card game got pretty popular thanks to the influence of rich companies like Kaibacorp. Who knows what they're capable of?
That's what I hope. Tournaments are fun and all, but often we have people entering to try and steal other players' cards.
Well, I suppose so. Joey does have a sister named Serenity, and she's very kind.
Y-yeah, but I don't mind it all too much. We've gotten out of the toughest corners together, so I can't imagine just forgetting about them.
I think you'll find that card games and board games are two totally different things, Bowsette!
<i>(She's right... I don't have my friends to back me up this time. I'll have to just do my best!)<>
Friendship... it's like a treasure you can see, but you also can't. So I'm going to show you just what it can do!
Best friends are hard to leave but impossible to forget! That's something you'd never understand!
No matter how dark things may get, the special bond I share with my friends will always find a way to shine through! I may be scared, but that fear won’t keep me from dueling!
I think I found out I hate rich people...
Oh yeah? What are
G-gosh, you think so? I mean, if you like it that's cool too.
You know it, DMG! Even though we're not dueling together this time.
I'm losing all control...
Yugi, Joey, Mai, where are you?
This can't be happening. This is just plain horrible!
The deck! It's sensing my doubt! I don't know if I can do this...
~cheat~, I better not see you try anything funny.
I've seen Yugi and Joey deal with plenty of people like ~cheat~. Whatever trick they have, I'll know it's coming.
Alright, I'm gonna take my bra off. I'm just... not sure how I can compare to you, ~idol~.
(With ~idol~ here, she's sure to take some attention away from me.)
What, me? Give up? No way!
Oh geez, we've really gotten to this point?
Wait, give me some time to prepare first...
I thought for sure that would work.
I gotta stop thinking in Duel Monsters terms.
No biggie. Gotta start somewhere.
So much for a perfect win.
My turn now. I wasn't really expecting to go perfect.
My turn now. I was hoping it would be a little bit challenging.
Well, so far, I'm finding this to be much less complicated than Duel Monsters.
Not bad, but we're just getting started!
Ah, just a minor setback. I'm just getting warmed up.
Oh, so I gotta go now? Alright, but don't expect me to take off something big. I'm doing my shoes first.
Well, this is it. I was hoping to have more of a buildup, but here we go.
Alright, I'm ready. Let's do this.
Minor setback. I can't let up now.
Hmm, I'm winning, but with how luck based this game has been, I wonder how long it will last.
Okay, I'm up next!
So far it's been a pretty easy game. Either I'm just really lucky today or we should have picked something more difficult to play.
Can't win them all, right?
Alright, I see. Can't end it yet.
Dealer, if you're rigging the deck to make this happen, you could have just asked.
Good play, but it'll take a lot more than that to psych me out!
Ohh, this isn't over yet!
Not my day, huh?
Alright, what next? I'll do my vest, I suppose.
I can't catch a break, can I?
Down to my last legs. But I won't stop here. You'll see!
I take back everything I said about this game being easy.
Me? But I thought I was doing fine!
I'll make a comeback soon-- wait and see!
No, wait! Lemme get ready first!
Oh no!
What is going on?
Don't think I'm giving up just yet!
Talk about a rough first impression.
Man, what a bummer.
Maybe I'm just not cut out for poker. It feels similar to Duel Monsters, but the strategies are completely different.
Maybe I'm just not cut out for poker. It's not like dancing where I can pick up any style on the fly.
Yeah, I'm not liking this. Duel Monsters and Dungeon Dice aren't nearly this luck based.
Is it too late to choose another game?
Damn it, I still have much to learn.
Are you doing something to the deck, dealer?
You see that? This is way too luck based!
You see that? This is like if you keep drawing Kuriboh every turn!
Oh, they're all over. Miku is even the mascot for some of them. I seem to do pretty well at those.
Yeah, like you're one to talk. You're doing even worse than I am.
Maybe I don't, but I still got heart, and I'll never forget that!
It's an annoying setback, but those are the rules.
Well, you got me good May. Guess I can join you now!
Good idea bringing a duel disk, Chazz. Why didn't I think of that?
Oh, uh, thanks. I did pretty well in the duels I wore this in, so I hope something good comes out of it.
I'm sure a card that lets me do that would break the game. I'd know the right cards to swap every time.
I don't mean to brag, but I once schooled a guy called Johnny Steps at that game, so I'd say pretty good.

There's one card I remember well called Dark Magician. He was meant to serve the Pharoah, and since the Pharoah's spirit was guiding my friend Yugi, the Dark Magician seemed to naturally fight with him.
There are plenty of machine type monsters that function like real machines so I don't think there's any moral there.
Who even knows where the spirits are today? After all, the only ones that were able to fight with spirits are magicians in themselves, like the evil sorcerer Marik.
You know, I guess I never really thought of that. We kinda just accepted it after our adventures.
Yugi-- I mean, maybe? You think he's into that stuff?
You sound like you'll enjoy this more than anyone. Yeah, maybe I'll humor you.
I guess you could put it like that. Like training for my mind.
You must have cotton in your ears! Card games are where I made my big break!
My friend Yugi was guided by a spirit in his Millenium Puzzle. That's why so many bad guys were after him. If he lost, he loses the spirit too.
More often than not the bad guys enter tournaments to steal rare cards and Yugi often meets them in the finals. Some of them were hell bent on world domination.
If you like hamburgers, there's plenty of places to go, like Burgerpalooza.
